meanings.definition: To throw or hit a ball in a high arc.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys lobbing the tennis ball over the net during practice.
meanings.sent2: The baseball player was lobbing the ball to the outfielder.
meanings.sent3: The kids were lobbing water balloons at each other on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent4: The chef was lobbing ingredients into the pot to create a delicious stew.
meanings.sent5: The magician skillfully lobbed the playing cards into the audience, impressing everyone.

meanings.definition: To throw or hit something in a high arc.
meanings.sent1: He was lobbing the frisbee to his friend at the park.
meanings.sent2: The gardener was lobbing the fallen leaves into the compost pile.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys were lobbing coconuts at the tourists, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The painter was lobbing paint onto the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The quarterback expertly lobbed the football to his receiver for a touchdown.

meanings.definition: To hit a ball in a high arc.
meanings.sent1: The golfer was lobbing the ball towards the green on the final hole.
meanings.sent2: The beachgoers were lobbing the volleyball back and forth in the sand.
meanings.sent3: The students were lobbing paper airplanes across the classroom, much to the teacher's dismay.
meanings.sent4: The archer was lobbing arrows at the target with precision and skill.
meanings.sent5: The pitcher lobbed a slow ball, tricking the batter and striking him out.
